author: costin
msg: Few small improvements.
If not appname is specified - take the name of the embeding container ( less
config for the user )
IMPORTANT: the thread class loader must be set to find login modules
in container ( like MemoryLoginModule ). For JAAS1.0 - that doesn't
help ( LoginModules must be in CLASSPATH - jboss actually has a hack
around it, but it's too complex ), but in JDK1.4 it does work fine.
If no principal is found ( but login succeded ) - use the user name to create
a principal.
Implement the "Roles" Group - I'll revert if anyone -1.

author: costin
msg: Fixes.
The digester that reads the users.xml file expects a MemoryRealm ( there is
a cast ) - and a lot is duplicated, so I just extended it.
Added a lot of debug - I may remove it after it's tested a bit more.
( it is quite difficult to figure out what's broken without debug,
and this is a tricky subsystem )
The last part is just duplicating MemoryRealm.

author: costin
msg: Deal with the case when Service is used to start the server ( no Server ).
Remove one more use of the ServerFactory - we already know the Server ( its
the lifecycle instance )
Sorry for the extra diff - it seems they had some whitespaces and my editor
removed them ( I'll try to fix that setting )

author: costin
msg: Few getters ( Remy: don't panic, I'm not changing the loader ! ).
The array will collect the loaders that are set into the class loader
and allow JMX to view the actual classpath ( if the loader is registered ).
I also added a bit more info in case something is missing.
Knowing the exact classpath of a webapp can be extremely usefull when debugging
strange bugs...

author: costin
msg: - remove unused imports
- switch to commons-logging
- lazy creation of the deployer. I did it because of some class loader problems ( but
the problem was elsewere ) - however it is good because we may use a different mechanism.
The "deployment" should be done using JMX - registering / unregistering mbeans
with JSR77 names should be enough.
- moved the extra JMX getters from the wrapper in mbeans/
- when the host mbean is created directly by JMX, register with the engine
